Package generation

Class MazeContainer

java.lang.Object
generation.MazeContainer
All Implemented Interfaces:
Maze
public class MazeContainer extends Object implements Maze
Class encapsulates access to all information that constitutes a maze. A maze is considered a rectangular arrangement of positions called cells such that each cell is on a position (x,y) with 0 <= x < width and 0 <= y < height of the maze. For each cell, one can tell where wallboards are in any of the CardinalDirections (north, south, east, west), how many steps it is to the cell that is at the exit of the maze, and what is the starting position for the game. The starting position is a cell that is farthest away from the exit position. A maze is assumed to have only a single exit and sufficient walls to make it interesting to play. A MazeContainer also holds information in a BSP tree for drawing visible walls. A MazeContainer is generated and initialized in the generation of a maze and not expected to change when the user plays the game because walls are not expected to change during the game (only their visibility). In particular, the current location and the current direction of the user while playing the game are not stored in this class.
Author:
Peter Kemper

  • Constructor Details

    • MazeContainer

      public MazeContainer()
      Default constructor leaves object in an state that requires a series of set methods to be called for proper initialization. These are setWidth, setHeight, setMazecells, setMazedists, setRootnode, and setStartingPosition

    • MazeContainer

      public MazeContainer​(int width, int height, Floorplan floorplan, Distance mazedists, BSPNode root, int startingPositionX, int startingPositionY)
      Constructor with values for all attributes, delivers a fully operational maze
      Parameters:
      width - is the width of the maze, must conform with Constants.SKILL_X values
      height - is the height of the maze, must conform with Constants.SKILL_Y values
      floorplan - the floorplan to set, must not be null
      mazedists - the mazedists to set, must be not null
      root - the rootnode to set, must be not null
      startingPositionX - is on the horizontal axis, 0 <= x < width
      startingPositionY - is on the vertical axis, 0 <= y < height

    • getPercentageForDistanceToExit

      public float getPercentageForDistanceToExit​(int x, int y)
      Calculates a distance to exit as a percentage. 1.0 is for the starting position as this is the maximal distance possible.
      Specified by:
      getPercentageForDistanceToExit in interface Maze
      Parameters:
      x - is on the horizontal axis, 0 <= x < width
      y - is on the vertical axis, 0 <= y < height
      Returns:
      a value between 0.0 and 1.0, the smaller the closer

    • hasWall

      public boolean hasWall​(int x, int y, CardinalDirection dir)

      Specified by:

      Parameters:

      y - is on the vertical axis, 0 <= y < height
      dir - is the direction in terms of North, East, South, West
      Returns:

      public int[] getExitPosition()
      Provides coordinates (x,y) of the exit position for this maze. This position is still inside the maze but at the very cell that has the exit at one of its sides.
